metadata.title: CVE-2013-4388 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the mp4a packetizer (modules/packetizer/mpeg4audio.c) inVideoLAN VLC Media Player before 2.0.8 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4388` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.1-1
libvlccore8 - 2.1.1-1
vlc - 2.1.1-1
vlc-data - 2.1.1-1
vlc-nox - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
